title: The Cho Lab is recruiting 1-2 highly motivated PhD students & 1 Postdoctoral Associate to join the team in Fall 2026!
body:
• PhD Position in Coastal Hydrology: Investigating Coastal Floods and Groundwater–Surface Water Dynamics in Coastal Unban Systems

• MS Position in UAV Remote Sensing : Advancing Multiple Remote Sensing Techniques to Enhance Hydrologic and Environmental Monitoring.


Generally, prospective students are expected and have the flexibility to work on the following topics (but not limited to):

• Hydrology and extreme events (flooding, drought, wildfires, heatwaves, etc.)

• Climate change & human impacts on hydrology & water resources

• Satellite remote sensing techniques and applications

• Snow hydrology & cold-land processes (snowpack, snowmelt, and freeze/thaw cycles)

• Land surface hydrologic modeling and data assimilation

• Big data analytics and machine learning applications


We are seeking candidates with strong experience in

• One or more programming languages (Python, R, MATLAB, and Google Earth Engine)

• Satellite and/or UAV-based remote sensing

• Statistical and/or big data analytics with AI/ML applications (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)


Prospective students are encouraged to contact Prof. Cho (eunsang.cho@txstate.edu) with the subject line: “Fall 2025 Ph.D. Position” to discuss candidate's capabilities and funding opportunities before submitting an official submission via the website. Successful candidates will have an opportunity to conduct collaborative research as an intern or a visiting student/scholar at leading research institutions and other universities including NASA GSFC and USDA Hydrology and Remote Sensing Lab. Applications from members of underrepresented groups and/or first-gen students are strongly encouraged. Please note that, due to the high volume of emails, Prof. Cho may only respond to emails that include a complete list of the following documents.


Please include the following documents as a single PDF in your email: 

1. A one-page cover letter (describing specific experience relevant to the research topics and career goals)

2. A CV

3. English proficiency score (TOEFL, IELTS, etc.) 

4. GRE score 

5. Unofficial transcripts

Suitable candidates will be contacted via email to schedule an interview. 

Official Application Deadlines via https://www.gradcollege.txst.edu/programs/ceng-phd.html

  1. Priority Deadline: January 15, for full consideration of school fellowships and departmental assistantship opportunities.
  2. Standard Deadline: June 1, for project-specific funding opportunities.
